The ceiling fans were a welcome addition for air movement during our warm stay. Filtered water in the fridge door saved us from having to buy bottled so environmental kudos! The decor was updated and calming. The location got us quickly to all major streets so moving around town was very convenient. We had a really nice stay and would stay again instead of using a hotel!

review_text: This is seriously a hidden gem. FANTASTIC for families it had everything a family could need: bibs, kid dishes, sound machine, baby monitor, bath seat and toys, even baby shampoo. They had baby bottle brush, countless toys, stroller, wagon and even a booster seat. We were blown away by this amazing place. Great location in a safe neighborhood with grocery, coffee, and restaurants in under 6 min drive. 3 families stayed 7 adults and 5 kids under the age of 5. Something for everyone big and small. All of my questions were answered quickly and there were countless little touches that made our stay. Kitchen is fully stocked with all appliances you could need. Plenty of bedding and towels with 12 people we went through so many towels and never ran out. Lots of storage areas to tuck items away. The hall closet even had a shoe rack for all the kids shoes. We could have stayed for a month but sadly all we had time for was 1 unforgettable weekend. We will be staying again!

And our large group loved the common spaces, especially on the deck. We agreed that staying at New Nostalgia was so much better than staying in a hotel where you're separated by floors, have to gather in uncomfortable common spaces, and store food in awkward situations. None of those inconveniences crossed our minds at NN!! We cannot wait to return to this beautiful and relaxing location!!!

Group trip
review_text:
This home was perfect! Best AirBnB we've ever stayed in!
Amy made us feel like family. We were in town for a family funeral. We felt so at home in Amy's house that we really relaxed and focused on being together as family.
Really, we couldn't think of anything else she could do to make the stay better. The home is beautiful, came nearly as fully stocked as our own home, and with too many attentions to detail to list.
We worked out in the garage gym space, played Cornhole & on the swing set, lounged in the hammocks, played video games on the big screen and board games at the table down stairs, we bbq'd & enjoyed the relaxing back patio, entertained the little ones with adorable toys, cooked in the well stocked kitchen with ease, and slept well on the super comfy beds.
The ONLY reason I would hesitate to give this a great review is that I'd like to be able to stay here again if we visit Lincoln -- and selfishly hope there will be "room in Amy's inn".
Thank you so much Amy and Todd! Hope you get much joy out of hosting!

review_text: This place was immaculate and beautifully decorated. My wife loved it, and she's an interior designer. Daryl and Sally thought of everything that a guest would need from drinks in the fridge and snacks on the counter to instructions on how to use the higher tech items. Even a little first aid kit in the bathroom. The condo is perfectly located downtown close to Haymarket and tons of restaurants. But the location is a double-edged sword and the only section I took off one star. On the weekend, there is a lot of nightlife traffic and even though the condo is on the 5th floor, you can still hear it quite a bit. Not Daryl and Sally's fault the builder didn't use better soundproof windows. Just bring some earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Not a huge deal, though. We do plan to rent this condo again in the fall when we stay in Lincoln.

Daryl was polite, friendly, and so thorough with the instructions I barely had to ask anything - but he responded quickly when I did.
Would absolutely recommend staying here if you visit Lincoln.

name: Dana
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The location is utter perfection. Especially as a visitor from big city ... we couldn't imagine staying in other parts of Lincoln and not having some fun bars to walk to at night. The apartment is large and clean. But the halls and stairwells are dirty. If you can ignore the public areas and go quickly up to your loft, you won't have any complaints.
The coin-op dryer took our money and spun for the expected time but when the cycle finished, we had cold soggy clothes. Hopefully they get it fixed quickly and you won't have this problem.
The noise from outside is minimal, if at all. That was a treat. But, there are metal industrial doors to the stairwell and the neighbors. Neighbors were very disrespectful and even into the late hours of the night, would come and go slamming doors which literally rattled the walls in the loft and woke us up many times.
Overall, since I will only every stay in downtown Lincoln and it's important to have a kitchen to make/eat my own food, this is a GREAT option for the price. I can take the good with the bad but not everyone has their priorities in the same place as mine so wanted to put this out there for those who it might help ....

However, there were a few areas for improvement. Namely some loose door hinges/door knobs and broken dining chairs. The noise level from the street and thin walls within the building were distracting at times, and parking was incredibly hard to find.
Overall, we had a great time and the location was as advertised. I would stay again, maybe just at a quieter time of the year.

Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: LeeAnn was responsive to me at my first inquiry and continued to be so through all interactions. Her profile states that she and her husband enjoy meeting new people, and this was accurate. They are warm, friendly, and conversational folks, who made us feel comfortable and welcome throughout our stay. Though it was only 1 night, I can understand the appeal to someone wanting a much longer stay. The townhouse is so easy to reach (we used our phone's GPS to get there from the interstate), and is conveniently located near through-streets for getting around Lincoln. The bedroom and bathroom were impeccably clean; the bed was very comfortable, and the temperature in the room was pleasant with a ceiling fan for use. The most obvious characteristic though, was the absence of street noise, guaranteeing a peaceful sleep. I encourage anyone looking for a well-appointed room with excellent hosts to check out this place.

What a beautiful place to get away. Our purpose was to rest and the Eden satisfied that goal perfectly. Located in the countryside, the Eden was easily accessed and was amazingly comfortable. The cottage does sit on the families property so it is not 100% secluded, but the peaceful area provided a serenity that we needed.
The amenities are wonderful. The kitchen was easily adapted to, the utensils were were clean and amazing for cooking our breakfasts and preparing our lunches. With tile floors the rugs were helpful and the bathroom floor is HEATED!!
Our interactions with Tom were sociable and friendly and he helped us feel welcome to explore the flowerbeds and green house.
Definitely worth looking into if you are in the Lincoln area!!

Will definitely go back again. Highly recommend!

We were on the road for eight hours (or more) each day, so having a place for our pup to run around and stretch his legs after a long day in the car was just terrific. Stayed with a pet
review_text: This was the first time we took our two dogs to an airbnb and it was a great experience. Laura obviously knows dogs! She has dog towels and bowls and toys, and even left our pups some treats. The yard is securely fenced and easy to access from the house. But there is no 'doggy smell' in the house, and no dog hair anywhere. The house really is impeccably clean. People without pets would be comfortable here - it's sunny, nicely remodeled and decorated, but not fussy. The bathroom is roomy and the shower is a treat. There are a few nice touches that show Laura really does care about providing a welcoming experience. She's also a good communicator. The bedding is comfy but we did find the pillows to be uncomfortably over-stuffed and ended up using rolled blankets as pillows. The neighborhood is peaceful with people out walking dogs and kids walking home from school. Staying there was a nice homey Nebraska experience.

It was conveniently located within 10-15 minutes of almost everything. Very minimal amenities. Because of the very and dusty weather in Nebraska it would have been nice to have a washer and dryer. Especially having to take multiple baths during the day. We made it through.
We would like to recommend updating the bathroom lighting be switched to "white" bulbs in the vanity instead of "soft" lights. It's hard to get full coverage doing makeup for the events we attended. Also, you may want to consider updating the microwave - it's time.
Our stay overall was great and would definitely come back again! Thank you so much!

review_text:
Can't say enough positive things about Laura's stay. We rented this house over the Thanksgiving holiday and we felt right at home. Laura is very communicative--anything you need, she responds very quickly. You likely won't need to reach her, because she's already thought of everything!
Things I really appreciate about Laura's home:
1. It's sparkling clean and Laura takes COVID precautions very seriously.
2. This home isn't just dog friendly, it's dog FORWARD! She provides cloths for cleaning dog paws, poop bags, ceramic dog bowls, and instructions for covering furniture. Traveling with our pup is normally stressful, but not at those home. The sizable, fully-fenced yard saved us!
3. The house doesn't feel like a rental, it feels so cozy. We felt so welcome and at-home.
Will definitely stay again next time we're in Lincoln.

review_text: Moving from Florida to Idaho, I had my most valuable possessions with me in my car and wanted a safe and secure location to stay and park over night. As check-in time neared, Alicia reached out to me for my ETA so she could be there to greet me. As I arrived I found it to not only be secure, but it was the most peaceful setting I could ever have imagined to recover at after two full days of driving. What an absolutely wonderful property and such gracious hosts to have found for my second overnight. Aliciaâ€™s husband, Steve, provided a thorough orientation of the guest cottage and suggested local fuel and food options. Although the property seemed so remote and removed, I was happily surprised to find a Costco gas station so conveniently close as well as an abundance of popular dining options. I wish I had more time to enjoy the area and Aliciaâ€™s guest cottage. If I ever find myself in the Lincoln, NE area and in need of lodging, Aliciaâ€™s place will be the first place I look for to stay.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at Alicia's place was terrific. We sent a message as soon as we arrived and Alicia's husband was out in just a couple of minutes to welcome us and walk us into the cottage. Everything was comfortable, clean, and just what we needed for our daughter's wedding weekend (I especially appreciated the pitcher of fresh cold water in the fridge!).
During our stay, my husband had lost his wedding ring and we looked everywhere, or so we thought. After we checked out, we received a message that they had found a ring outside by the front door and it was definitely my husband's! I was hoping it was still back at our house so I hadn't ask them to look yet.
We coordinated the exchange with one of my daughters that lives near Lincoln and had a very pleasant messaging conversation as we set that up.
Highly recommended and would come again. Many thanks to Alicia and her husband!

review_text:
Lisa's apartment was lovely! Light, clean charmingly decorated, super comfy bed, well set-up kitchen. It had everything I needed, & lots of storage space (a huge walk-in closet). Very quiet too.Coin-operated washing machine in building's basement--I didn't use it.
Lisa is an exceptionally kind, helpful and responsive host--she even left a Pilates mat out for me :) And all instructions were very clear.
One caveat: If you are a more "vulnerable" traveller (I was a lone-travelling woman, no car), the neighbourhood may not be the most convenient. I needed to walk everywhere, and didn't always feel comfortable; it was quite a walk to Haymarket (groceries, restaurants, cafes, bars) but an easy walk to UNL campus, & The Mill cafe is only a 12-min. walk--but again, through not-the-most-salubrious neighbourhood. The building is not the most salubrious either--take Lisa's advice and use the external stairs to take you direct to the apt.
But the apartment was delightful. Lisa, a perfect host.

review_text:
READ ALL OF THE REVIEWS. I learned the hard way.
We loved the interior layout of the Airbnb, but didn't realize that there was only a small window air conditioner for the entire space. It's the heat of summer, so the space was warmer than we were comfortable with.
We ended up getting a hotel room instead, because it was uncomfortably warm, and we were unsettled by the building itself. There are several flights of stairs and you have two options - interior (which is as unsettling as other reviews suggest) or the fire escape. I've recently hurt my knee and didn't realize what we were signing up for lol
I'm terrified of heights, and the "back staircase" was a contributing factor in our decision to not remain at the Airbnb. I didn't see anything in the listing about it, but it's on me for not reading through all of the reviews beforehand. There are also a few other reviews, regarding parking, host communication, and rodents that freaked us out.

review_text:
The check-in instruction was clear, and the parking was convenient, just in front of the outside stairs. The communication with Lisa was easy, and I got quick responses.
The unit is very clean and cozy, but I developed severe contact rashes/ itchy from the comforter each time I touched it. Since it was hot and so we didnâ€™t need it anyway. The building is old and smelly; hence, we mostly used outside stairs which was the most scary part for my son.
When we stayed in Lincoln, the weather was hot (over 100) even at night and humid (~ 60%), there was only one small window AC in the bedroom which could barely cool down the bedroom, and so the living room was hot all day long. Lisa offered to bring another window AC, but due to our crazy schedule, I didnâ€™t see that message until the end of our stay, which was a bummer. If you are a hot intolerance person, you may want to give Lisa a heads up before you arrive.

The location is great for walkability, as others have pointed to. Lisa has provided all necessary accommodations, and the communication was clear and prompt. The apartment has everything you could need, and some additional nice touches (board games, nice cookware, nice furniture).
The downsides: The building itself has slight issues, and seems to be older with primarily student/young residents. It has a variety of smells throughout and does not feel very clean. Smokes smells do permeate into the condo. With young folks residing here, conversations/music persist through the night and walls are thin. There are a lot of people coming and going late into the evening, which did make me feel slightly uncomfortable.

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I stayed one night on a cross-country roadtrip and this was a great location for exploring Lincoln. It is right across the street from the capitol, which seems like the tallest thing in the state so it makes navigation very easy. Near bike trails, coffee shops, restaurants etc. Lisa was very communicative to make the whole process easy.
To address some of the negative comments I saw in other reviews: Parking is super simple, just look at the photos Lisa sends you. Depending on how you get into the lot it's the first spot that you see. Yes it's oriented differently than some of the other spots, but hopefully you can figure it out anyway. There also seems to be plenty of street parking.
The exterior stairs felt super safe to me. I hauled all my luggage up and down plus my bike and it was fine. If you're not used to metal exterior stairs, you can go around and use the front door. If you don't want to do four flights of stairs at all, you probably need to look elsewhere.
Some of the reviews called the unit "run down", which is not true at all. It's not new construction, probably from the 1920s, but the unit is well kept, nicely appointed, and 10% functional.

Bathroom has beautiful sunlight coming through in the morning. Comfortable bed with enough space. Closet is HUGE, has a lot of room for anything. Living, dinning area are super cozy and comfortable to enjoy.
Super cute space! I recommend it.

review_text:
I was looking for a place to put my head down during a road trip, but especially a place to do a little laundry.
I am not faulting anything for the stairs, I just missed the information, butâ€¦
The lock box is precariously hanging from a ladder over the 35 foot drop to the ground. The stairs are transparent, so anyone with a fear of heights beware! And, finally, there was no washer and dryer. I am sure there was a facility somewhere on site, but I donâ€™t think that is what anyone is looking for when the ad says the unit has a w/d. Also, we had to use the photo of the parking spot to figure out the spot because the painting was so faded. If it were not for all the photos the host sent, we would have been lost. I was also unsure if I needed the parking pass in my car. I assumed so, so add an extra run up and down the stairs to put the pass in the car and to put the pass back in the apartment when leaving. One quick fix would be to put the lockbox at the bottom of the stairs instead of the top. Finally, a $64 room cost me over $120. I am new to Airbnb, but this is ridiculous. Am I paying resort fees or something? Hiding extra profit in â€œcleaningâ€ is bad faith, like a $5 eBay auction with $30 shipping.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
The good: Lisaâ€™s home was beautifully laid out and had just what we needed for our short stay. The instructions were clear, and she was fast to communicate with us when we needed assistance. No complaints.
The not so good: This isnâ€™t on the host at all- itâ€™s more my lack of foresight in my planning (which is why I still gave 5 stars). The apartment is on the fourth floor as is noted in the description (with no elevator)- and we were traveling cross country with a toddler- so not only did we have a few bags and things to bring in, but it was really cold with 4 flights of stairs to climb, plus fumbling in the dark over the lock box, a door that swings toward you to open, and a mostly student-occupied building which made the check in process an overwhelming one. I think if I was traveling alone or with one other person it would be fine, but this mama was at the end of her rope carrying a fussy toddler up a zillion stairs with heavy bags. We ended up leaving a lot of what we had originally planned to bring in in the car because of the stairs situation. Again, this isnâ€™t on the host- the description was accurate. This was just my experience. I wouldnâ€™t suggest it if you have a baby or toddler- or if youâ€™re not a light packer, like me.
Would be happy to come back all alone though! Haha!

review_text: Located in a pretty well traveled part of town, but in a good way. The parking area is a bit confusing, but luckily there was a gentlemen in the lot who informed us parking in the exactly right spot wasn't a big deal either way. My wife and I stayed here for a night and had to bring bikes up to the room with us...not ideal as the room is on the top floor and there is only stair access, but the host was gracious enough to let me know about this ahead of time which made me happy. The building is a bit older and with that comes the smells of an older building. Once you're in for a bit, you get used to it and overall, it's pretty good value as far and my wife and I were concerned.

It was comfortable, clean and quiet, and just as adorable as in the pictures. The kitchen was well equipped, too. Other reviewers aren't kidding about the rest of the building. The halls are dingy and it looks a bit run-down. That said, I never felt unsafe, and the contrast between the sad halls and the perfectly decorated apartment was sort of entertaining to me. I would stay there again if I'm in Lincoln again!
